Posts.Content: Ps, sorry, I don't wear my prosthesis unless in going somewhere special, I'm happy to be flat chested daily. I do have a pair of Knitted Knockers though and they are great to wear if it's too hot, might suit for night, I've never worn them at night, x
Posts.Title: Comfort of my softie prosthesis

Posts.Content: Ps, sorry, I don't wear my prosthesis unless in going somewhere special, I'm happy to be flat chested daily. I do have a pair of Knitted Knockers though and they are great to wear if it's too hot, might suit for night, I've never worn them at night, x
Posts.Title: Comfort of my softie prosthesis

Posts.Content: Hi folks, sorry for late reply. I applied for my pair of "Knitted Knocker" when I found them on Facebook, didn't think it would happen anytime soon, as they said they were very busy. Then on 3rd January this year they arrived in the post, I was going in for my third surgery on the 5th January,, a lady called Chriss D made them for me, they came in a lovely white organza bag with extra stuffing to adjust the size. They have practically no weight and I don't sweat when I wear them. I would recommend that everyone should apply to them, if it's a single knocker or a pair, it's such a lovely feeling inside when they arrive, as someone, a complete stranger took the time out of their life to make me them! Good luck folks, hope you are all as well as can be expecte, x
Posts.Title: Comfort of my softie prosthesis

Posts.Content: Hi, I had my second mastectomy on 5th January and my scar is very puckered and tight, I had a Seroma on this side, the left side was done in August 2013, that healed a lot better than this right one is healing, it's very puffy but hard too, has anyone else had this too?
